findings.title: ERC20 API violation
findings.description: The Approve function of ERC-20 is vulnerable to Multiple Withdrawal Attack allowing spender to transfer more than allowed by another user.

findings.title: Malicious libraries
findings.description: The audit report mentions malicious libraries as a finding but does not provide further details.

findings.title: Compiler version not fixed
findings.description: It's recommended to lock the compiler version in code, as future compiler versions may handle certain language constructions in a way the developer did not foresee.

findings.title: Send instead of transfer
findings.description: Using 'send' instead of 'transfer' can lead to gas issues and potential reentrancy vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Coding Style Issues
findings.description: Smart Contracts have naming convention, indentation and code layout issues. It’s recommended to use the Solidity Style Guide to fix all the issues.

findings.title: Unchecked external call
findings.description: The finding indicates a potential vulnerability where an external function call is made without proper checks or validation.

findings.title: Implicit Visibility
findings.description: It’s a good practice to explicitly define visibility of state variables, functions, interface functions and fallback functions.

findings.title: Timestamp Dependence
findings.description: It is risky to use block.timestamp as it can be manipulated by miners and therefore recommended to be supplemented with some other strategy in high-value/risk applications.

findings.title: Use of tx.origin
findings.description: The use of tx.origin can make a contract vulnerable to phishing attacks.
